title: LR circuits - compare R2 pd for switch open-closed

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A circuit, constructed as shown in the figure, consists of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>, a switch, an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, Resistor <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of resistance <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and Resistor <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of resistance <math alttext="n times R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math> is a positive integer. The switch has initially been open for a long time. The switch is then closed at time <math alttext="t equals, t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>. The currents in the circuit are allowed to reach their steady state values, after which the switch is again opened at time <math alttext="t equals, t sub O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>O</mtext></msub></math>. (a) Indicate how the magnitude <math alttext="delta V sub C 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> of the potential difference across Resistor <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" (b) Derive an expression for the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V sub O 2, and denominator delta V sub C 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>O2</mtext></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>C2</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>. Express your answer in terms of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi></math> and physical constants, as appropriate. Begin your derivation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference information.
(c) Indicate whether the expression you derived in part (b) is consistent or not consistent with the relation you selected in part (a). Justify your answer.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
